concept.title: Processing Rules
concept.shortdesc: Processing rules simplify data collection and manage content as it is sent to reporting.

conbody.p: Processing rules help simplify interaction with IT groups and Web developers by providing an interface to:

ul.li: Set an event on the product overview page
Populate campaign with a query string parameter
Concatenate category and page name in a prop for easier reporting
Copy an eVar into a prop to see paths

li.p: Pull internal search terms or a campaign ID from the query string into an eVar

strow.stentry: Watch the Processing Rules overview and training from Adobe Summit to learn why you should be using processing rules.

section.title: Get Authorized to Use Processing Rules
section.p: All users (including administrators) must be granted authorization to use processing rules by Adobe. The authorization process is described in Become authorized to use Processing Rules.

We recommend that a limited group of administrators (usually 2-3) have access to processing rules, so that all requested changes are centrally managed. It’s best to have more than one processing rules user so there is a backup user in case urgent changes need to be made while one administrator is unavailable. Because processing rules permanently affect Analytics data, we strongly recommend that processing rules users be well trained in Adobe Analytics, and be familiar with all sources of data for your report suites (standard web sites, mobile sites, mobile apps, Data Insertion API, and so on). Knowledge of the context data variables and standard variables populated in various platforms will help prevent accidental deletion or alteration of data.

section.title: Use Context Data to Simplify Data Collection
section.p: Context data variables are a new type of variable that are available only to processing rules. To use context data variables, key/value data pairs are sent in by your implementation, and processing rules are used to capture these values in standard Analytics variables. This frees programmers from understanding exactly which prop and/or eVar should contain which value.
See Context Data Variables in Implementation Help.

section.title: Use Processing Rules to Transform Hit Data and Trigger Events
section.p: Processing rules can monitor incoming values to transform common typos and set events based on reported data. Props can be copied to eVars. Values can be concatenated for reports, and events can be set.
